page.syntax: C table.xml_export(C tablename ,C filename [,C fields [,C filter [,C order [,L silent [,L open ]]]]])

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The name of the table that will provide the data to export.

argument.name: filename
argument.description: The name of the XML file to create.

argument.name: fields
argument.description: Optional. Default = all fields. Comma delimited list of fields to take data from.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = all records. An expression that selects records.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = record number order. An expression that orders the selected records

argument.name: silent
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .F. Whether to display a confirmation message before exporting the data, or before overwriting Filename.
.T. = Do not display a confirmation message.
.F. = Display a confirmation message.

argument.name: open
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .T. Whether to open Filename with the associated application.
.T. = Open Filename.
.F. = Do not open Filename.

page.description: Exports data from a table to an XML file. Specify * to export all fields.
page.discussion: The TABLE.XML_EXPORT() method exports data to an XML file.

section.description: Parts of the xml file are included below.
section.example:
CUSTOMER_ID Character 8 0
FIRSTNAME Character 20 0
....
00000047 Brad James
(207) 555-9489
185 Albany St 12th Floor Westbrook ME 04092
True
....
